sentences.en: Although he pretended to sympathize, he was laughing in his sleeve.
sentences.cn: 虽然他假装同情, 但他却在暗笑.

sentences.en: As he drew abreast of the man he pretended to stumble.
sentences.cn: 当他赶上那个男人时，他装出了要跌倒的样子。

sentences.en: He pretended not to know her but in fact they were in league together.
sentences.cn: 他假装不认识她,而实际上他们是串通一气的.

sentences.en: He pretended profundity by eye - beamings at people.
sentences.cn: 他用神采奕奕的眼光看着人们,故作深沉.

sentences.en: He pretended to be affronted, but inwardly he was pleased.
sentences.cn: 他假装受到了冒犯，但其实内心很高兴。

sentences.en: He pretended to be seriously interested in all she said.
sentences.cn: 对她说的每一句话,他都装出一副很认真很感兴趣的神气.

sentences.en: He pretended to scalp me with his sword.
sentences.cn: 他假装要用剑剥下我的头皮。

sentences.en: Her eyes widened in pretended astonishment.
sentences.cn: 她眼睛瞪得大大的，假装很吃惊。

sentences.en: I pretended to rub a fleck of grit from one eye.
sentences.cn: 我假装拭去一只眼睛里的沙粒。

sentences.en: It was a no-win situation. Either she pretended she hated Ned and felt awful or admitted she loved him and felt even worse!
sentences.cn: 这个问题没法解决，要么她假装讨厌内德，自己难过；要么承认自己爱他，然后觉得更糟！

sentences.en: The boy pretended to be the teacher and hit her off to perfection.
sentences.cn: 这个男孩假装老师,模仿得很像.

sentences.en: The young prince pretended to the throne.
sentences.cn: 那位年轻的王子觊觎王位.

sentences.en: They pretended that they were tourists.

words.tran_cn: 借口；虚假；炫耀；自吹（等于pretence）
假装（pretend的过去式和过去分词）；装扮

trans.tran_cn: 假装的，徒有外表的，传说的，号称的
trans.tran_en: something that is pretended appears to be real but is not

trans.tran_cn: 假装( pretend的过去式和过去分词 )，伪装，（尤指儿童）（在游戏中）装扮，自诩
